component.name: Gargoyle

description.p: Gargoyle is an IF player that supports all the major interactive fiction formats.

Most interactive fiction is distributed as portable game files. These portable game files come in many formats. In the past, you used to have to download a separate player (interpreter) for each format of IF you wanted to play.
Gargoyle includes the AdvSys, Agility, Alan 2 and 3, Bocfel, Git, Glulxe, Hugo, JACL, Level 9, Magnetic, Scare, ScottFree, and TADS 2/3 interpreters.

ul.li: $HOME/garglk.ini is loaded on macOS again.
Fallback fonts work on macOS again.
Better support for non-ASCII filenames on Windows.
Transcripts update in real time again.
Fixed some cases where Agility save/restore prompts didn’t work on macOS.
Fixed media loading in JACL and Hugo.
Avoided potential crash with newer versions of SDL2_mixer.
Readline-style shortcuts are now available on macOS.
Interpreter updates: Agility 1.1.2, Alan3 3.0beta8, Bocfel 2.1.1, Git 1.3.7, Glulxe 0.6.0.
New interpreters: Taylormade and Plus, supporting more Scott Adams-style games. ScottFree updated to support graphics. Thanks to Petter Sjölund.
Support for glkunix_fileref_get_filename().
Color theme support with automatic light/dark following.
Optional KDE Frameworks integration to improve text editor behavior.
Window size and location can now be saved/restored between sessions.
Proper monospace font usage in the Agility interpreter.
Z-machine bleeps are now supported.
Unifont is used to look up missing glyphs.
Implements Glk version 0.7.5.
Various interpreter updates.
Unix and Windows UI now use Qt.
New sound backend based on Qt.
Experimental Haiku OS support.
Migrated from SDL1 to SDL2 (thanks to Manuel Stoeckl).
Removed built-in fonts due to licensing issues.
Default proportional font is now Charis SIL ("Gargoyle Serif"); default monospace is still Go Mono ("Gargoyle Mono").
Improved font rendering with FreeType tuning (thanks to Tynach).
Improved Fontconfig lookup to avoid wrong styles.
HiDPI support on macOS.
Fixed font selection on Windows.
Fixed interpreter locating on FreeBSD.
Updated many interpreters.
Added text-to-speech support.
Built-in fonts support a wider range of Unicode.
Full-screen support added.
Various accumulated small fixes and updates.
Native ports are now available for Enlightenment and Open Inkpot.
Added Glk 0.7.1 features: line input echo and terminators, window border hint, Unicode decomposition and normalization.
Added Glk 0.7.2 features: date and time functions.
Added support for Treaty of Babel metadata.
Very small text buffers now scroll properly.
Hyperlinks are now stored with all 32 bits.
The background color in grid windows is now fully applied.
Scrollback buffer is truncated on window resize to improve responsiveness.
Fixed game launch hangs on OS X 10.7 (Lion).
Bundled Liberation Mono fonts were incorrectly marked as proportional; this has been corrected.
Added Bocfel 0.6.0 for Z-machine stories; Bocfel is now the default Z-machine interpreter.
Glulxe is now the default Glulx interpreter for Superglús story files.
Added ScottFree 1.14 for SAGA stories.
Interpreter command-line flags are now supported in garglk.ini.
Interpreter updates: Alan3 3.0b2, JACL 2.8.5, Glulxe 0.4.7, Git 1.2.9, Level9 5.1.
Frotz fixes: correctly handles the fixed-width bit in the header and repositions the cursor after writing to the final grid column.
Geas now displays menus correctly.
TADS improvements: implements the banner API, supports Unicode, and allows timer events during line and character input.
